snippet: Two new studies out of Europe have confirmed what researchers had long suspected: rates would fall and mental acuity improve as populations grew healthier and better educated.
abstract: British study published in journal The Lancet finds that dementia rates among people 65 and older in England and Wales have plummeted by 25 percent over past two decades; Danish study also in The Lancet finds that people in their 90s given mental ability test scored substantially better than their counterparts decade earlier; both confirm researchers suspicions that mental acuity improves as populations grow healthier and better educated.
lead_paragraph: Two new studies out of Europe have confirmed what researchers had long suspected: rates would fall and mental acuity improve as populations grew healthier and better educated.

headline.main: Dementia Rate Is Found to Drop Sharply, as Forecast
headline.print_headline: Dementia Rate Is Found to Drop Sharply With Better Health and Education
